metadata.title: CVE-2020-7062 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
In PHP versions 7.2.x below 7.2.28, 7.3.x below 7.3.15 and 7.4.x below7.4.3, when using file upload functionality, if upload progress tracking isenabled, but session.upload_progress.cleanup is set to 0 (disabled), andthe file upload fails, the upload procedure would try to clean up data thatdoes not exist and encounter null pointer dereference, which would likelylead to a crash.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-7062` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.0 - 7.0.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.14
libphp7.0-embed - 7.0.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.14
php7.0 - 7.0.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.14
php7.0-bcmath - 7.0.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.14

criterions.comment: php7.0 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.14').
